titleInfo.title: Herzog v. Scanlan
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 5 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. Plaintiff is not required to pay the filing fee in this matter. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party and Norfolk Regional Center) (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 5 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. Plaintiff is not required to pay the filing fee in this matter. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party and Norfolk Regional Center) (JAB)

titleInfo.title: Herzog v. Scanlan
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The court now conducts an initial review of the Complaint to determine whether summary dismissal is appropriate. 1. Plaintiff's Motion for Leave to Amend Complaint (filing no. 4) is granted. 2. Plaintiff's injunctive relief claim for a tax exemption and Plaintiff's request to initiate criminal charges against Defendant and to revoke Defendant's medical license are dismissed. 3. Plaintiff's Fourteenth Amendment claim against Defendant for monetary damages may proceed, in accordance with this Memorandum and Order, and service is now warranted. The Clerk of the court shall send ONE (1) summons forms and ONE (1) USM-285 forms to Plaintiff for completion and return. (***Pro Se Case Management Deadlines: 10/7/2009 Check for completion of service of summons.) Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party with 1 summons and 285 form.)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The court now conducts an initial review of the Complaint to determine whether summary dismissal is appropriate. 1. Plaintiff's Motion for Leave to Amend Complaint (filing no. 4) is granted. 2. Plaintiff's injunctive relief claim for a tax exemption and Plaintiff's request to initiate criminal charges against Defendant and to revoke Defendant's medical license are dismissed. 3. Plaintiff's Fourteenth Amendment claim against Defendant for monetary damages may proceed, in accordance with this Memorandum and Order, and service is now warranted. The Clerk of the court shall send ONE (1) summons forms and ONE (1) USM-285 forms to Plaintiff for completion and return. (***Pro Se Case Management Deadlines: 10/7/2009 Check for completion of service of summons.) Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party with 1 summons and 285 form.)(JAB)

titleInfo.title: Herzog v. Scanlan
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Defendant's Motion for Summary Judgment (filing no. 30) is granted. Herzog's Motion for Summary Judgment (filing no. 19) is denied. A separate judgment will be entered in accordance with this Memorandum and Order. All other pending motions are denied as moot. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: Herzog v. Scanlan
titleInfo.subTitle: STRICKEN - ORDER. It is ordered that: (1)The following matter previously scheduled before the undersigned is herewith referred to Judge Zwart, to wit,(A)Nature of hearing:Pretrial conference.(B)Date and time of hearing: Tuesday, April 6, 2010, at 11:00 a.m.(C)Place of hearing: Judge Zwart's chambers, Room 566, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall, North, Lincoln, Nebraska.(2)Judge Zwart will issue a report and recommendation or order as is appropriate. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, ) Modified on 1/20/2010 to strike pursuant text order (GJG).
